or you haven't tried it yet i highly recommend you jump into the console and go in and look at it
reason being is trusted advisors a way for our customers to be able to make sure that they get the most value for their investment in
their aws account it's going to scan your environment and run a set of checks in there to make
sure that you're kind of adhering to aws best practices and that's going to be like we see here
on the screen between security fault tolerance performance cost and those service quotas
and it's going to be able to give you a variety of different checks and information that is going to be able to help you to
implement those things in your account um so a little bit more uh into what each one of these does
so i said if you haven't used it it will help you save money we have a cost optimization
checks in there and these will give you recommendations that can potentially save you money by highlighting unused resources or
opportunities in general to reduce your bill and this may be low utilization ec2 instances
idle rds databases or just adding on things like reserved instances and savings plans to your account to
help you bring down your aws bill we have performance in there as well and
that's going to make recommendations that can help improve the speed and responsiveness of your application
uh one of the opposite checks from the cost optimization is if you have an over utilized ec2
instance and that just basically means if you're using 85 of your cpu it's going to trigger a check just to make
sure that in your environment you're not you know limiting the performance of your application by having an overused ec2 instance and
that might make you help the difference you know by scaling up or scaling out your resources to accommodate for that
security wise uh this is going to go in a very important one uh help you identify the security in
your environment where you might need to make fixes and this could be just simply enabling mfa on your road account
um we've kind of covered before on here as well as being one of those really important things to have implemented
and trusted advisor will help you to view that uh in your account to make sure that you can then implement that you know
kind of fundamental check we recommend fault tolerance is going to make sure that you have your
infrastructure in place where you have safer production databases that you're using multi-az rds so if you use a relational database
services making sure that for your production clusters you don't just have a single point of failure and it'll make recommendations
for you to deploy it say multi-az might even be just that you have ec2 instances that you're deploying
in your account and it'd be best if you spread those across the azs so that way you don't just take up
one in case there's some kind of issue in that az you know that you have resiliency throughout that as well
and then your service limits or service quotas are just going to be making sure that if you're in your environment and
you're bumping up say against the number of vpcs you can have in your account or number of elastic ips that you can have
in your account it's just going to let you know that you might need to action on those
and those come up in those trusted advisor check levels and that's going to be giving you green that hey no problems are detected
right you followed through in your cost optimization you've implemented best you can your performance at all the other
areas and there's nothing really to do yellow is going to say investigation recommended this doesn't
necessarily mean there's an issue so much as it doesn't adhere to our best practices
and it should just be taking a look at to see if there is potential for you to implement something where you can you know make an improvement or
change to your environment red action is one that we just highly recommend you action on
so that mfa on root that i was mentioned before if you don't have that in your account

and those service limits uh so there'll be six checks for security uh helping you just to identify things
like that road mfa and some security group items but then for our business and enterprise support customers they get access to all
